original: Serana can make you one of us again.
string: 瑟拉娜可以讓你變回我們同類。

original: Quite bold, to return here as a mortal. Some will take offense.
string: 變成凡人之後還敢回來，真是大膽。有些人可能會覺得被冒犯。

original: You really ought to become one of us again. Bad for your health, otherwise.
string: 你真的應該變回我們同類。否則你的壽命可能會受損。

original: You're mortal? What are you doing here like that?
string: 你是凡人？你為什麼還要回來？

original: No, no, you must get away! If I'm seen talking to you, they'll blame me!
string: 不，不。你必須立刻離開！如果被人看到我跟你說話，他們會怪罪於我！

original: Mortals aren't allowed to freely roam the castle. Not even you.
string: 凡人不能隨意在這座城堡中走動。就連你也不行。

original: Find Lord Harkon at once and ask him to please... "correct" the situation.
string: 立刻去找赫岡大人請求他......「改正」目前的情況。

original: You are worth very little if you're not one of us.
string: 你如果不是我們同類就幾乎沒有價值了。

original: Serana can change that. I suggest you ask her to.
string: 瑟拉娜可以改變你。我建議你去找她。

original: If you're not one of us, you're just another piece of meat.
string: 你如果不是我們的同類，你就只是一塊肉。

original: Talk to Serana, and decide which you want to be.
string: 去跟瑟拉娜談，決定你想成為什麼。

original: I await your answer.
string: 我在等你的答覆。

original: Maybe this will put your mind at ease. (<bribecost> gold)
string: 也許這能消除你的疑慮。（賄賂<bribecost>金幣）

original: Please, it's very important that I find him. (Persuade)
string: 拜託你，我一定要找到他才行。（說服）

original: That's right. You've seen him?
string: 沒錯。你有看到他嗎？

original: Have you seen a Moth Priest?
string: 你有看到先祖蛾祭司嗎？

original: Oh, good. Well then... let's head over to the portal vessel and I'll do the rest.
string: 喔，好吧。我們去傳送門容器那邊，其他交給我來處理。

original: I already found all of the ingredients.
string: 我已經找齊所有的材料了。

original: Oh, definitely. Mother would have plenty of those materials in her laboratory, you just need to find them.
string: 喔，當然。我媽會把大多數的材料放在研究室裡，只要在這裡找就行了。

original: Are all of those ingredients here?
string: 所有的材料都在這裡嗎？

original: Not the most solid construction here. About what I'd expect from... creatures like this.
string: 這建築看起來不是很穩固。老實說我不感到意外，畢竟是那種生物蓋的......

original: It sounds like they were both being selfish.
string: 他們聽起來似乎都很自私。

original: Definitely. You must think my life has been so strange. It sounds like your family wasn't nearly as fractured as mine.
string: 當然。你一定覺得我的生活很奇怪。聽起來你的家庭不像我的那樣破碎。

original: Oh, they definitely were.
string: 喔，他們非常自私。

original: I just wonder if that meant it was my job to be giving.
string: 我只是想說，我自己也應該做點什麼。

original: Anyway, we should keep moving.
string: 算了，我們繼續前進吧。

original: It probably didn't have anything to do with you.
string: 那也許跟妳無關。

original: That's easy to say, but I definitely didn't help things.
string: 用說的容易，但是我真的沒有幫到忙。

original: You shouldn't blame yourself.
string: 妳不應該責怪自己。

original: You don't know what it's like, coming from a family like that.
string: 你不懂在那樣子的家庭長大是怎麼一回事。

original: Everything eventually tumbles down to you.
string: 任何事情遲早都會落到你身上。

original: I know that in my head. But I just can't help feeling bad about... the way things are.
string: 我內心也知道。但是我對於目前的情況......還是感到很難過。

original: Sorry, I know you're trying to help. Thanks.
string: 抱歉，我知道你想幫我。謝謝你。

original: It sounds like you already didn't like him much.
string: 聽起來你不是很喜歡他。

original: Like I said, we were never very close. Not a lot of father-daughter bonding if you know what I mean.
string: 我跟你說了，我跟他一直都不親近。沒有什麼父親女兒之間的交流。

original: But once we threw our lot in with Molag Bal... people just don't think about their families anymore. "Power takes precedence," he always said.
string: 但是等到我們加入莫拉格．巴爾之後，他更不會想到家庭了。「權力優先」，他總是這麼說。

original: Did your mother keep gargoyles here?
string: 妳的母親在這裡放石像鬼？

original: Not that I ever saw.
string: 據我所知是沒有。

original: My mother had a bit of a thing for magical constructs. Not... not what you're thinking. She just found them fascinating.
string: 我的母親對魔法生物有種偏愛。不......不是你想的那樣。她只是覺得它們很神奇。

original: I've never even seen this part of the castle before. Be careful. I don't know what might be around.
string: 我從來沒到過城堡的這一頭。要小心，我不知道這裡會有什麼。

original: Do you know this place?
string: 妳來過這個地方嗎？

original: I had always just assumed that the other tower was completely destroyed inside.
string: 我總以為另一座塔的內部已經完全被摧毀了。

original: My mother kept this a secret, even from me. She must have been up to something she thought was dangerous.
string: 這件事我母親連我都瞞著。她一定是在進行她認為危險的事情。

original: That sounds pretty lonely.
string: 聽起來很孤單。

original: It was.
string: 是很孤單。

original: But I got used to it.
string: 但是我習慣了。

original: You sound like you were a weird little kid.
string: 聽起來妳以前是個古怪的小孩。

original: I was.
string: 我是啊。

original: But I think I turned out ok.
string: 但是我長大後就正常了。

original: What did this area used to be?
string: 這個區域原本是用來做什麼的？

original: Who knows? It was in shambles when we first got here.
string: 誰知道？我們一開始來的時候已經崩壞了。

original: My father's never been much for building things, so it just stayed like this.
string: 我的父親對於建造東西不感興趣。所以這裡維持原貌。

original: The poor thing living here probably just fell out of favor upstairs.
string: 住在這裡的可憐東西可能失去上面的寵愛。

original: This leads out to the courtyard. Just head for the door.
string: 這裡通往庭院。朝門的方向走就是了。

original: Did you spend a lot of time down here?
string: 妳以前常待在這裡嗎？

original: I liked to explore. My parents almost never let me off the island, so yeah, I poked around down here a lot.
string: 我喜歡探索。但我的父母不讓我離開這座島，所以你猜得沒錯，我常在這裡玩耍。

original: It was a little... quieter... back then. Guess a little vampire girl was enough to scare off the rats.
string: 以前這裡......比較安靜。看來吸血鬼小女孩就足以嚇跑那些老鼠了。

original: Take a left up here. This is one of those weird double-barred security measures that my father put in when he got more paranoid.
string: 這邊要往左走。這是我父親裝設的雙層防護措施，他後來真的有被害妄想症。

original: If we follow that path around, we can find the other switch.
string: 如果我們繞到另一頭就可以找到另一個開關。

original: The old water cistern. On some days, this would smell just... be glad you weren't here then.
string: 舊的水道。它有時發出的臭味簡直......你該慶幸自己當時不在這。

original: Never mind, I'll look somewhere else.
string: 算了。我去問別人。

original: Maybe this will put your mind at ease. (<bribecost> gold)
string: 也許這能消除你的疑慮。（賄賂<bribecost>金幣）

original: Please, it's very important that I find him. (Persuade)
string: 拜託你，我一定要找到他才行。（說服）

original: That's right. You've seen him?
string: 沒錯。你有看到他嗎？

original: Have you seen a Moth Priest?
string: 你有看到先祖蛾祭司嗎？

original: I'll try my luck elsewhere.
string: 我去別的地方試試運氣吧。

original: Finding that Moth Priest is worth a lot to me. (<bribecost> gold)
string: 找到那名先祖蛾祭司對我來說很重要。（賄賂<bribecost>金幣）

original: I'll try my luck elsewhere.
string: 我去別的地方試試運氣吧。

original: Finding that Moth Priest is worth a lot to me. (<bribecost> gold)
string: 找到那名先祖蛾祭司對我來說很重要。（賄賂<bribecost>金幣）

original: Never mind, I'll look somewhere else.
string: 算了。我去其他地方看看。

original: My lord! Everyone! Serana has returned!
string: 我的主人！大家！瑟拉娜回來了！

original: Wait... Serana? Is that truly you? I cannot believe my eyes!
string: 什麼......瑟拉娜？真的是妳嗎？我不敢相信自己的眼睛！

original: How dare you trespass here!
string: 你居然敢擅闖此地！

original: Well, it seems the Dawnguard really is needed again.
string: 看來暮光守衛真的又被需要了。

original: While I ready things here, you find out what this woman means to the vampires. She must be important somehow.
string: 我準備東西的同時，你去找出那個女人對吸血鬼的重要性。她一定是關鍵人物。

original: I'll admit, I don't know that I can trust you, but I know I can't rely on the Vigilants for anything. So we'll have to work together for now.
string: 我得承認，我不知道能否信任你，但我知道自己無法信賴警戒者，所以我們現在得互相合作才行。

original: If you can prove you're reliable, maybe you can join the Dawnguard. We have ways of dealing with vampires.
string: 要是你能證明自己可以被依靠，也許你就能加入暮光守衛。我們處理吸血鬼有自己一套方法。

original: I don't know, but she must be connected.
string: 我不知道，但是一定跟她有關連。

original: Why her? What significance does she have? We don't have enough information.
string: 為什麼是她呢？她有什麼重要性？我們的情報不足。

original: She just wants to go home.
string: 她只想要回家。

original: None of this feels right. We need to know more.
string: 這感覺很不對勁。我們需要知道更多。

original: They were trying to free a woman trapped in a crypt.
string: 他們試著把一個困在墓穴裡的女人救出來。

original: None of this makes any sense. What does she have to do with this?
string: 這一切都不合理。她跟這一切又有何關連？

original: Do we at least know what the vampires are after?
string: 我們知道吸血鬼要的是什麼嗎？

original: I don't relax. Ever.
string: 我不休息。從不。

original: Right. Well, you can relax. I have it under control.
string: 好吧。你可以休息了。我已經控制局面了。

original: I can't afford to make any assumptions. That's how people wind up dead.
string: 我不能允許任何假設。絕對會有人因此而死。

original: You know I'm more than capable. Why are you bringing this up?
string: 你知道我的能力足夠。你為什麼又提起呢？

original: Can I cound on you to handle whatever smithing work we need done? Repairs, new armor, weapons...
string: 鐵匠的工作像是維修物品、製造新護甲跟武器全交給你了，相信你的能力足以承擔。

original: This is a statue of Auriel, but it's using the older signs of his power. This temple must be ancient.
string: 這是奧麗瑞的雕像，但是這些象徵力量的符號是早期的版本。這座神殿一定很古老。

original: The bow has to be in here.
string: 弓一定在這裡。

original: That... has to be the place. I've never seen a building like that before.
string: 這......一定就是這裡。我從來沒見過這樣的建築物。

original: It looks like some kind of temple.
string: 看起來像是某種寺廟。

original: Does this ice feel a little... thin to you?
string: 這層冰，不覺得有點薄嗎？

original: Ugh. I told you!
string: 啊，我早就跟你說了！

original: Next time I say to please not go over the waterfall, maybe you'll listen to me.
string: 下次我叫你別穿越瀑布的時候，麻煩你聽我的意見。

original: Careful, here. If you fall down that thing I'm going to have to drag you out of... wherever it leads.
string: 這裡要小心。要是妳掉下去的話，我還得要把你從那什麼地方拉出來。

original: More spiders? I liked the ones back home better.
string: 更多蜘蛛！我比較喜歡老家的蜘蛛。

original: I think that's another wayshrine up there. Here we go.
string: 上面那應該也是一座指路祭壇。我們走吧。

original: Is that another one of those wayshrines up there? I wonder where this one goes...
string: 上面那是指路祭壇嗎？不知道會通到哪......

original: These things are everywhere, aren't they?
string: 這些東西到處都是。

original: If we open that one, we'll be able to move around this valley a lot faster.
string: 如果我們開啟了這一座指路祭壇，就可以快速在峽谷內移動。

original: This is incredible. It's like a whole other world.
string: 這太神奇了。像是全然不同的世界。

original: Poor thing. I know it would have tried to kill us, but still...
string: 可憐的東西。我知道它會試著殺掉我們，但是......

original: Looks like they're better at making traps than they are at making bridges.
string: 看來他們製作陷阱的技巧比製造橋樑要來得高超。

original: A strange race, these Falmer.
string: 真是奇怪的種族，這些伐莫。

original: Why is that?
string: 怎麼說呢？

original: The Elder Scrolls vanished from the Imperial City around 175 of this era and have been scattered across Tamriel by forces unknown.
string: 上古卷軸於這紀元的一七五年左右從帝都消失。之後被某種力量散佈在整個泰姆瑞爾大陸。

original: If you want to find the remaining scroll, you'll have to consult with someone versed in magical knowledge. Perhaps at the College of Winterhold?
string: 如果你想要找到剩餘的卷軸，你就必須跟熟知魔法相關知識的人尋求意見。也許你該拜訪冬堡學院。

original: I need the Elder Scroll that speaks of dragons.
string: 我需要那份關於龍的上古卷軸。

original: I wish I could help. The scrolls have changed hands so many times, it's impossible to keep track.
string: 我真希望我幫得上忙。但是卷軸已經換過太多次主人，要追蹤實在是太難了。

original: Normally, I'd send you to the Imperial City in Cyrodiil to seek answers at the Imperial Library, but that avenue no longer exists.
string: 正常來說，我會要你前往賽瑞迪爾的帝都。在帝國圖書館找答案。但是那地方已經不存在了。

original: Any clues about the other Elder Scroll?
string: 有其他上古卷軸的線索嗎？

original: Dexion said something about that scroll. What was it... something to do with dragons I think?
string: 戴希翁說了什麼關於卷軸的事。是什麼呢？我記得好像跟龍有關......

original: Maybe we should try asking at the College of Winterhold. Sounds like something they'd know about.
string: 也許我們該前往冬堡學院找尋答案。他們應該有那方面的知識。

original: These Vigilants never know when to give up. I thought we'd taught them enough of a lesson at their hall.
string: 那些警戒者總是不知道適可而止。我以為我們在警戒者之家已經讓他們嘗到教訓了。

original: If you're putting yourself in harm's way, you'd best be prepared. Take these.
string: 如果你打算去冒險，那你至少應該做好準備。這些拿去吧。

original: The Chalice has been in Lord Harkon's possession for quite some time now. It is, when used properly, able to increase the potency of our powers.
string: 赫岡領主持有聖杯已經很久了。如果適當使用，它能夠強化我們的力量。

original: He has neglected using it for ages. If he wants it filled now, then grander things are afoot. This is good.
string: 他已經數十年沒有使用它了。今天領主想要把它斟滿，代表將會有重大的事情發生。這是好事啊。

original: Follow me. I'll take you to it.
string: 跟我來。我帶你去拿。

original: Of course. Hasn't everyone?
string: 當然。誰會沒有聽過？

original: No.
string: 停。

original: Don't try and impress me. It only leaves you looking foolish.
string: 別不懂裝懂。那只會讓你顯得愚笨。

original: I've never heard of it.
string: 我從來沒聽說過。

original: It is a rather well-kept secret.
string: 那可以說是一個非常保密的機密。

original: I have news, but I wouldn't call it good.
string: 我帶來情報，但是不是好的。

original: Of course. Why did I suppose differently. Fine, tell me what you know.
string: 就知道。我早就猜到了。好，來告訴我你知道的。

original: Not exactly.
string: 不算是。

original: Damn. Well what do you know?
string: 該死的。好吧，你查出了些什麼？

original: Look at this. I should've known it was only a matter of time before they found us.
string: 你看。我早該知道他們遲早會找到我們。

original: It's the price we pay for openly recruiting. We'll have to step up our defenses.
string: 這就是公開招募的下場。我們得要加強守備才行。

original: I don't suppose you have some good news for me.
string: 我想你應該沒有什麼好消息要報告吧？

original: What is this place?
string: 這是什麼地方？

original: I've heard the rumors around Skyrim. I know something's going on. And I've seen the vampires.
string: 我聽到了天際省四處流竄的謠言。我知道有事情正在發生。我也看到吸血鬼了。

original: I felt I had two choices. I could either live in fear of the night, or I could do something to help protect my people.
string: 我覺得我有兩個選擇。我可以選擇畏懼黑夜，或是選擇保護我的人民。

original: We hunt down and kill vampires. Haven't you been paying attention?
string: 我們的工作就是追殺吸血鬼。你都沒在注意聽嗎？

original: In the old days, the Dawnguard kept all of Skyrim safe from those bloodsucking scum.
string: 以前暮光守衛保衛著整個天際省，防止這些吸血的廢蟲作亂。

original: Then people stopped taking the threat seriously, the Dawnguard was disbanded, and the vampires came creeping back.
string: 但是人們逐漸不再重視這個威脅，後來暮光守備就被解散了。而吸血鬼則悄悄地重新壯大起來。

original: Now I'm trying to reestablish the Dawnguard. Take the fight to the vampires for a change. I hope it isn't too late.
string: 我現在試著重新組織暮光守衛。直搗吸血鬼的巢穴。我希望還未太遲。

original: This is Fort Dawnguard.
string: 這裡是暮光守衛堡壘。

original: Originally owned by the Jarl of Riften back in the Second Era, it was a bit of a black mark on the Hold's history.
string: 在第二紀元的時候，這堡壘曾經屬於裂谷城的領主。那算是這座堡壘在歷史上的污點吧。

original: I'm trying to put it to good use.
string: 但我會試著將這座堡壘用於正途。

original: What is this place?
string: 這是什麼地方？

original: They also have an Elder Scroll.
string: 他們還有上古卷軸。

original: They what?
string: 有什麼？

original: And you didn't stop them? You didn't secure the scroll?
string: 你沒有阻止他們嗎？你沒有設法弄到卷軸？

original: The woman was a vampire, and they wanted her back.
string: 那女人是隻吸血鬼。他們想要把她帶回去。

original: And so we've delivered her right to them. I should've kept her here until we were certain...
string: 我們就這樣把她送給他們。我們確認之前應該把她留在這裡的......

original: Hmmm. Pull chains and traps. Be careful here. Whatever's on the other side of this, the Falmer wanted to keep there.
string: 嗯。鏈環跟陷阱。小心點。無論另一頭是什麼東西，那些伐莫族可是試著把它留在裡面。

original: Looks like these Falmer are here to stay.
string: 看來那些伐莫族要留在這裡。

original: They must be who that priest was calling "the Betrayed."
string: 他們應該就是那個祭司指的「背離之徒」。

original: That... wasn't as unpleasant as I thought it would be.
string: 這......沒有我想像那麼糟。

original: Kind of soothing, actually. I feel a little warmer, now.
string: 有種令人安心的感覺。讓我暖和了起來。

original: What's that? I can feel some kind of power from it...
string: 那是什麼？我可以感覺到某股力量從裡頭傳出來......

original: I wonder what happened to them.
string: 不曉得他們到底發生了什麼事。

original: These people were... why would anyone want to set up camp here?
string: 那些人被......怎麼會有人想在這裡紮營？

original: I'm not ready yet. Give me more time.
string: 我還沒有準備好。再給我點時間。

original: You are a guest in this castle at my pleasure. I'll permit you to stay for now, but you're of no use to me like this.
string: 我容許你成為這座城堡的客人。我可以暫時讓你留在這裡，但是你目前對我而言沒有用處。

original: I am ready to receive the ancient blood.
string: 我準備好接受上古之血。

original: Good. Do not offend me by losing it again.
string: 很好。你再弄丟的話可是會冒犯到我。

original: You have forsaken my gift. The ancient blood no longer flows through your veins. Don't deny it!
string: 你遺棄了我賜予你的禮物。上古之血不再流竄你的體內之中。別否認！

original: Count yourself fortunate that I'm a forgiving man. Now, be still while I give you the ancient blood once more.
string: 我是如此地寬容，你應該感到很幸運。現在別動，我要再給你一次上古之血。

original: If I'd known Skyrim was so dangerous, I'd have brought more guards.
string: 我要是知道天際省有那麼危險的話，就會多帶一些守衛了。

original: Ambushed by vampires... I certainly wasn't expecting that.
string: 被吸血鬼攻擊......這我完全沒預料到。

original: This is all more excitement than I'm used to.
string: 這一切對我來說有點太刺激了。

original: Very well, then.
string: 非常好。

original: Divines keep you safe, my friend.
string: 神會保佑你，我的朋友。

original: If you find any more Elder Scrolls lying about, be sure to let me know!
string: 如果你找到其他的上古卷軸，務必讓我知道。

original: Very well, master.
string: 是的，我的主人。

original: I will await your return.
string: 我會等待你的歸來。

original: Farewell.
string: 再會。

original: I have nothing more to say to you.
string: 我跟你沒有什麼好說的。

original: The Empire will send someone to find me. You'll see!
string: 帝國會派人來找我的。你看著吧！

original: Threaten me all you like, it won't matter.
string: 盡量威脅我吧。沒有意義的。

original: Find that Moth Priest! I will suffer no delays!
string: 找到先祖蛾祭司！我不容許任何耽擱！

original: Go now, and prove that my faith in you was not misplaced.
string: 去吧。證明我對你的信賴沒有白費。

original: If the Moth Priest has guards, show them no mercy.
string: 如果先祖蛾祭司有帶守衛，可別手下留情。

original: You've done well. I won't forget that.
string: 你做得很好。我會記得的。

original: Your obedience pleases me.
string: 你的服從令我感到喜悅。

original: Go, then, and do not forget who is your master.
string: 去吧。別忘了誰是你的主人。

original: You made a pact with Molag Bal?
string: 你跟莫拉格．巴爾締造了契約？

original: In an age long forgotten to history, I ruled as a mighty king. My domain was vast, my riches endless and my power infinite.
string: 早在歷史遺忘的年代，我曾經是名偉大的國王。我的疆土遼闊，我的財富取之不盡，我的力量用之不歇。

original: And yet, as my mortal life neared an end, I faced a seemingly invincible enemy -- my own mortality.
string: 但是當我的生命走向盡頭時，我遇到了一名我似乎無法擊敗的對手——我自己的死亡。

original: I pledged myself to Molag Bal, and in his name I sacrificed a thousand innocents.
string: 我對莫拉格．巴爾宣示忠誠，以他之名我奉獻了數千名無辜的百姓。

original: In reward, he gave everlasting life to myself, my wife and my daughter. And so I have defeated mortality itself.
string: 他給我、我的妻子以及我的女兒永恆的生命作為獎賞。我成功擊敗了死亡。

original: What is this place?
string: 這是什麼地方？

original: A shrine to Molag Bal, the mighty Daedra Prince who is father to all our kind.
string: 莫拉格．巴爾的祭壇。這位偉大的魔侯是我們所有人的父親。

original: Our power is a blessing from him. It is he who first bestowed the gift of the ancient blood upon me.
string: 我們的力量是他的恩典。是他將上古之血賜予我。

original: What happened? How did I get here?
string: 發生了什麼事？我怎麼會來到這裡？

original: My blood is potent. At first, the body is overwhelmed by it.
string: 我的血充滿力量。你的身體首先會先被它佔據。

original: After my bite, you collapsed and fell into a slumber. Now your flesh has acclimated to the new blood that courses through your veins.
string: 被我咬過之後，你昏倒並陷入睡眠。如今你的肉體已經習慣了在血管中奔竄的新血。

original: I assure you, no harm was done. In truth, your strength surprises me. Not all mortals can withstand my embrace.
string: 我跟你保證，沒有造成任何傷害。但老實說，你的力量令我感到驚訝。不是所有的凡人都能承受我的擁抱。

original: I'm ready to learn about my new powers.
string: 我準備好學習新的力量了。

original: With my guidance you will become a deadly instrument, striking terror in the hearts of mortals wherever you tread.
string: 由我來引導你，你將成為致命的凶器。你所到之處將散播恐懼在那些凡人的心中。

original: Now, listen to my words and do as I instruct.
string: 現在，照我的指示去做。

original: Awake at last, good.
string: 終於醒了，很好。

original: The power is growing within you, and now you must learn to wield it.
string: 你體內的力量逐漸茁壯。你現在必須學會使用它。

original: They used to call Windhelm, "the City of Kings." In my books, anyway.
string: 他們以前稱風舵城為「君王之城」。至少我書上是這麼寫的。

original: I had expected Ysgramor's city to be... bigger.
string: 我以為伊斯格拉謨的城市會......更大。

original: From the castle, you used to just be able to see Solitude over the mountains. It's exactly what I imagined.
string: 以前從城堡裡，可以看到山後的獨孤城。這裡就跟我想像中的一模一樣。

original: I'd read stories about the Solitude windmill, but I didn't expect it to be that big!
string: 我以前在書上讀過獨孤城的風車，但是我沒有想到會這麼大！

original: What a curious city. It's so... open.
string: 真是座奇特的城市。好......開放。

original: This place makes me a little uneasy.
string: 這個地方讓我不自在。

original: These people seem nervous, which makes me nervous.
string: 這些人看起來好緊張，連我自己也緊張起來了。

original: This land feels... twisted. I'm surprised my father didn't want to live out here.
string: 這片土地感覺有點......扭曲。我很驚訝我的父親不想住在這。

original: Rocks and valley, crevices and hiding places. This is the kind of place where hermits and fanatics dwell.
string: 岩礁跟山谷，裂縫跟藏匿處。這裡簡直是隱士跟狂熱者的最愛。

original: I've never seen leaves this color.
string: 我從來沒有看過這種顏色的葉子。

original: I'm okay with the dark, but I've spent more than my share of time in caves already.
string: 我不排斥黑暗，但是我在洞穴裡已經待夠久了。

original: Let's move faster. The sun is... it's not great for my skin, if you know what I mean.
string: 我們走快點吧。陽光......對我的皮膚不太好。

original: I was always taught to avoid these types of ruins. I think I see why, now.
string: 我一直以來被告知要避免這類的廢墟。我終於懂為什麼了。

original: Does the air feel... heavy down here? I'm a little woozy, but it might just be from waking up.
string: 這裡的空氣會很沉重嗎？我感覺有點頭昏眼花。但也許只是剛醒的關係。

original: It'll be good to get outside and breathe again. I haven't missed the sunlight, but I do miss fresh air.
string: 能夠到呼吸外頭的空氣會很不錯。我不想念陽光，但是想念新鮮的空氣。

original: Nervous?
string: 會緊張嗎？

original: You've got plenty of moths. What's our next move?
string: 你收集了好多飛蛾。接下來要做什麼？

original: Looks like we're on the right track.
string: 看來我們方向正確。

original: Dexion didn't really give us a lot to go on, did he?
string: 戴希翁給的線索有點少，對不對？

original: Well, we've got that knife. There has to be a use for it.
string: 嗯，我們拿了那把刀，應該會派得上用場吧。

original: This must be the place.
string: 一定就是這裡了。

original: I hope we reach Ancestor Glade soon.
string: 希望我們可以早日抵達先祖林地。

original: It's so bright out here. I don't know how you stand it.
string: 這裡實在太亮了，你怎麼受得了。

original: This must be that beautiful Skyrim weather I've always heard about.
string: 天際省傳聞中的宜人氣候應該就是這樣子吧。

original: I'm no fan of the sun, but it would be better than this.
string: 我不是很喜歡太陽，但是再怎樣也比現在好。

original: Let's get indoors. Or in a cave. Anywhere, just out of this.
string: 我們回到室內或是找個洞穴吧。哪裡都行，可以避開太陽都好。

original: Shouldn't we keep moving? I really want to get back home.
string: 我們不用繼續走嗎？我真的想趕快回家。

original: It's not too far, now. At least, I don't think it is. I thought you knew the way?
string: 應該距離不遠了。至少我是那麼想的。我以為你知道路。

original: Aren't we there yet?
string: 我們怎麼還沒到？

original: So... this is the place.
string: 所以......就是這裡。

original: Here we are. Ready to go in?
string: 我們到了。準備好進去嗎？

original: This isn't really a good time.
string: 現在的時間點真的不太對。

original: It's probably best for you if we're not seen together right now.
string: 我們不要一起被看見，對你來說會比較好。

original: So far this hasn't been too bad. Gets lonely exploring by myself, though.
string: 目前為止還不算太糟。但是我一個人探索就會有點孤單。

original: Where have you been?
string: 你去哪裡了？

original: Nothing like a goose chase around the whole damned province.
string: 繞遍整座該死的省份玩老鷹抓小雞真是有趣極了。

original: "The Tale of the Great Moth Priest Hunt." Not something I'd want to read.
string: 「追捕先祖蛾祭司記」。這書名聽起來就很難聽。

original: I'm a little nervous about all of this.
string: 我對這一切感到有點緊張。

original: So, this was my old stomping grounds. Not the most normal childhood.
string: 所以，這就是我小時候遊玩的地方。應該不算是很正常的童年。

original: I'll bet my parents didn't know the half of this part of the castle.
string: 我敢打賭我的父母親完全不了解城堡的這一端。

original: I promise you, it didn't always look like this.
string: 我跟你保證，這裡原本不是長這樣子的。

original: I miss the flowers.
string: 我想念花朵。

original: I'm wondering what my mother got up to, here. She definitely wasn't trying to keep the place clean.
string: 不曉得我母親來這裡的目的是什麼。她肯定不是來打掃的。

original: Well, looks like some other guests have taken over since my mother left.
string: 看來有別的客人在我母親離開後佔據了這個地方。

original: I was hoping it wouldn't smell this bad.
string: 我真希望這裡沒有那麼臭。

original: I can't imagine living here. Or... being dead here. Or... whatever they'd call it. Ugh.
string: 我不敢想像在這裡生活的日子。或是......在這裡死掉的日子。或是......我不知道這算什麼日子。呃......

original: Let's just find my mother and get out of here.
string: 我們趕快找到我的母親就離開這裡吧。

original: The quicker we find the Keepers, the quicker we can leave.
string: 我們越快找到守護者，就能越早離開。

original: Do you need something?
string: 你需要什麼嗎？

original: Oh, what is it?
string: 喔，怎麼了嗎？

original: What now?
string: 又怎麼了？

original: Yes?
string: 什麼？

original: Gah... let's clear out this steam so we can take a look.
string: 啊......你先把水蒸汽關掉，我們才能看仔細。

original: Is that... the Forge?
string: 這就是......熔爐嗎？

original: Amazing...
string: 太厲害了......

original: That took longer than usual. How deep are we?
string: 花的時間比以往都長。我們現在有多深？

original: Use the power of the ancient blood to transform into a Vampire Lord.
string: 使用上古之血的力量轉化為吸血鬼領主。

original: Transform into the Vampire Lord, and I will teach you more.
string: 轉化成吸血鬼領主之後我會再教你更多。

original: There is one last thing you must know. Slaying mortal men with your life drain grants you new night powers and blood magic.
string: 還有最後一件事情你必須知道。用吸取生命殺死凡人，你會獲得新的暗夜之力與血魔法。

original: I keep a stable of thralls in the castle should you need to feed like the baser vampires to stave off the sun.
string: 我在城堡內有養一批奴僕。你要是像其他低等的吸血鬼一樣想要躲避陽光就去享用吧。

original: Good. You are weaker while on the ground, because you cannot access the blood magic.
string: 很好。你在地面上會較弱，因為你無法使用血魔法。

original: However, the night powers are still yours to command, and your claws are still formidable weapons.
string: 但是你還能操控暗夜之力，而你的爪子也是優良的武器。

original: Should you run out of magicka, you can descend to the ground and fight as the beasts do.
string: 你的法力要是被耗盡了，就降落地面，像野獸那樣戰鬥。

original: Do so now and we will continue.
string: 現在照著做，我們再繼續。

original: In this form, you can drain the life from your foes with your right hand.
string: 在這個形態下，你可以用右手吸取敵人的生命。

original: With your left hand, you can wield the power of blood magic to raise the dead.
string: 用左手則能使用血魔法來召喚死者。

original: You can also call upon the powers of night to turn into a swarm of bats and reappear some distance away.
string: 你也可以呼喚暗夜之力轉化成蝙蝠群，然後在遠處重新現身。

original: The true power of the ancient blood is found in the form of the Vampire Lord.
string: 上古之血的真正力量要透過吸血鬼領主的型態才能運用。

original: Assume the mantle of the Vampire Lord, and we will continue.
string: 化身成吸血鬼領主，我們再繼續。

original: Maybe your mother didn't trust you, either.
string: 也許妳的母親也不信任妳。

original: That's always a possibility. She was almost as obsessed as my father by the time she shut me in.
string: 這也有可能。她把我關起來的時候已經快要跟我父親一樣狂熱了。

original: But I can't worry about that now. We need the scroll, and she's our only lead.
string: 但是我不能擔心這些。我們需要卷軸，而她是我們唯一的線索。

original: We can't waste time on cryptic clues.
string: 我們不能浪費時間在模糊的線索上。

original: If you have a better lead than this, I'm all ears.
string: 你如果有比這個更好的線索，我洗耳恭聽。

original: Does Harkon even care about you anymore?
string: 赫岡到底有沒有在關心妳？

original: You know, I've asked myself the same thing.
string: 你知道嗎？我也問過自己這個問題。

original: I thought... I hoped that if he saw me, he might feel something again.
string: 我以為......我原本希望看到我，可以刺激他再度對其他事物有所感覺。

original: But I guess I don't really factor in at this point.
string: 但是我想我沒有任何影響力可言。

original: What is it between you two?
string: 可以描述你們兩個人的關係嗎？

original: Ever since he decided to make that prophecy his calling, we kind of drifted apart.
string: 自從他把完成預言當作自己的使命之後，我們就漸行漸遠了。

original: I don't think he even sees me as his daughter anymore. I'm just... a means to an end.
string: 我不認為他還把我當作女兒。我只是他完成目的的工具。

original: Kill the abominations!
string: 殺死那怪胎！

original: Praise Arkay!
string: 讚美阿凱爾！

original: Send them to Oblivion!
string: 把他們送進湮滅！

original: This is it!
string: 這樣就對了！

original: Burn them all!
string: 燒光他們！

original: Death to the vampires!
string: 吸血鬼都去死！

original: Give him a crossbow bolt between the eyes for me!
string: 替我射一發到他的眉心中間！

original: Everyone! Gather 'round!
string: 大家！聚集起來！

original: Victory to the Dawnguard!
string: 勝利是暮光守衛的！

original: I have Auriel's Bow.
string: 我有奧麗瑞的弓。

original: The bow... you have Auriel's Bow!
string: 那把弓......你有奧麗瑞的弓！

original: I've heard it described in tales, but I could never have imagined its beauty.
string: 我在故事中聽過它的敘述，但是我無法想像它會是如此地美麗。

original: Mother?
string: 媽媽？

original: Are you all right?
string: 妳沒事吧？

original: I will be. Just give me a little time.
string: 我不會有事的。給我一點時間就行。

original: Don't...
Just leave me alone for a bit.
string: 暫時不要跟我說話吧。

original: Do you ever think about curing yourself?
string: 妳有想過治療自己嗎？

original: A cure? Why even think of it that way?
string: 治療？為什麼要那樣想？

original: I can't think of any reason I'd want to lose this gift. Especially after what I did to get it.
string: 我無法想像為何我需要拋棄這個禮物。何況我還大費周章才得到它。

original: It may have driven my family apart, but I'm still here, and I'm alive. I won't give this up.
string: 也許我的家庭因此變得支離破碎。但是我還在，我也還活著。我不會想要放棄。

original: It sounds like you weren't thinking clearly.
string: 聽起來妳沒有想得很透徹。

original: I'm not sure it's really your place to judge me.
string: 我不認為你有資格批判我。

original: To judge us.
string: 或是批判我們。

original: My family has its problems, but they're our problems.
string: 我的家庭有問題。但那些是我們的問題。

original: Let's just... move on from here, ok?
string: 我們別再說這個了，可以嗎？

original: How has it affected your family?
string: 妳的家庭受到什麼影響？

original: Well, you've met most of us. My father's not exactly the most stable, and eventually he drove my mother crazy with him.
string: 你幾乎都遇見了吧。我的父親心理狀況不是很穩定，後來把我母親一起逼瘋了。

original: And it all ended with me being locked underground for who knows how long.
string: 我則是被關在地底下不知道多久。

original: It's definitely been a bad thing, on the whole.
string: 整體來說，肯定是不好的影響。

original: Do you regret becoming a vampire?
string: 妳後悔成為吸血鬼嗎？

original: Nobody's ever asked me that before. I... I don't know.
string: 沒人問過我這個問題。我......我不知道。

original: I think... mostly I hate what it's done to my family.
string: 我想......我主要是恨它對我家人造成的影響。

original: How did you actually become a vampire, then?
string: 那妳是怎麼成為吸血鬼的？

original: The ceremony was... degrading.
string: 整個儀式很......可恥。

original: Let's not revisit that.
string: 我不想去回想。

original: But we all took part in it. Not really wholesome family activity, but I guess it's something you do when you give yourselves to a daedric lord.
string: 但是我們全家都參與了。我知道那不算是健康的家庭活動，但是把自己奉獻給一個魔侯，可能就得做那樣的事。

original: Molag Bal created the first vampire.
string: 莫拉格．巴爾創造出第一隻吸血鬼。

original: Precisely.
string: 很正確。

original: Looks like you know your daedra.
string: 看來你對魔族有研究。

original: What you might not know is that for the most devoted and impressive followers, Molag Bal will give the gift anew, in its pure form.
string: 但是我想有一件事你可能不曉得。莫拉格．巴爾會重新賜予他最忠誠、最強大的追隨者一份禮物，那最純真的型態。

original: I would guess it came from a daedric lord.
string: 我猜那源自於魔侯吧。

original: Exactly!
string: 完全正確！

original: I don't know much about it.
string: 我其實不太懂。

original: The first vampire came from Molag Bal. She... was not a willing subject. But she was still the first.
string: 第一隻吸血鬼源自於莫拉格．巴爾。她......雖然不是自願的，但終究還是第一隻。

original: Molag Bal is a powerful daedric lord, and his will is made reality.
string: 莫拉格．巴爾是強大的魔侯，他的意念皆會實現。

original: For those willing to subjugate themselves, he will still bestow the gift, but they must be powerful in their own right before earning his trust.
string: 他賜予這份禮物給那些願意臣服於他的人，但是那些人本身就需要具備強大力量，要不然不可能取得他的信任的。

original: I admire your devotion.
string: 我很欣賞妳的付出。

original: Not many people understand the appeal. You keep surprising me.
string: 只有少數人才懂這吸引力。你真是令我猜不透啊。

original: I'm a follower of Molag Bal, myself.
string: 我自己本身就是莫拉格．巴爾的追隨者。

original: I have to admit, I'm impressed. I didn't think you had the spirit for it.
string: 我得承認你讓我印象深刻。我原本不看好你有這股熱情。

original: This isn't that watered down child's power that you simply contract from another vampire. We're pureblood creations of original vampires.
string: 這不像你從隨便一隻吸血鬼身上就能獲得的那種稀釋過後的小兒把戲。我們是最原始的吸血鬼創造出的純正血脈。

original: We earned this.
string: 那是我們應得的。

original: Now, you might already know that Molag Bal is the original source of vampirism.
string: 你也許知道莫拉格．巴爾是吸血鬼病最初的源頭。

original: What you probably don't know is that he still grants it to his more impressive followers.
string: 但你大概不知道他至今都還會把這份禮物賜予他最強大的追隨者。

original: The daedric princes disgust me.
string: 魔族的君侯讓我作嘔。

original: I know, I know, but just... anyway. Molag Bal is the original source of vampirism, and still grants it to his more worthy followers.
string: 我懂、我懂，只是......總之莫拉格．巴爾是吸血鬼最初的源頭。他至今都還會把這禮物賜予那些較有價值的追隨者。

original: Spare me the details.
string: 細節就不用提了。

original: The short version is that my parents and I... we were followers of Molag Bal.
string: 簡單來說，我的父母跟我......都是莫拉格．巴爾的追隨者。

original: I want to hear it.
string: 願聞其詳。

original: I guess... we kind of have to go way back. To the very beginning. Do you know where vampirism came from?
string: 我想......我們得要從頭說起。回到最初的時候。你知道吸血鬼病是從哪裡來的嗎？

original: We'll talk more when we're there.
string: 我們到了再說吧。

original: Keep your guard up.
string: 保持警戒。

original: Good luck out there.
string: 祝你好運。

original: I'll see you soon.
string: 下次再會。

original: Lead on.
string: 帶路吧。

original: Let's move.
string: 出發吧。

original: Not sure what you're waiting for... step into the light.
string: 你在等什麼？踏進光內吧。

original: Lead on.
string: 帶路吧。

original: That bark's pretty fragrant, no wonder the moths are attracted to it.
string: 這樹皮的味道還滿濃郁的，難怪飛蛾會被吸引過來。

original: Time to gather some bark.
string: 收集些樹皮吧。

original: Let's keep looking around.
string: 我們四處去看看。

original: Don't worry, we'll find the glade.
string: 別擔心，我們會找到林地的。

original: ...still always hungry... there's no prey down in this hole... need to hunt more... all this hiding and skulking around, pah...
string: ......總是飢餓......這洞裡沒有獵物......需要打獵......到處躲藏窺視，煩死了......

original: ...first kill is always the best... the blood has never tasted as sweet since...
string: ......第一個獵物總是最好的......之後的血喝起來都沒有那麼甘甜......

original: ...I won't hide down here forever... gather a few of the brethren, we'll strike out on our own...
string: ......我不會永遠躲在這下面......我會召集一些兄弟，我們會一起打獵......

original: ...maybe the clans have it right... hunting's so chancy... why not keep a few thralls... blood whenever you want it...
string: ......也許氏族的作法才是正確的......打獵太靠運氣了......養一些奴僕就好了......隨時供應鮮血......

original: ...blood... so hungry all the time now... need to hunt again soon...
...she said I'd forget, and usually I do, but sometimes... still remember their faces, their pleading...
string: ......她說我會忘掉......我平常真的記不得......但是有時候......會想起他們的面容，他們的哀求......

original: ...Dawnguard getting to be more than a nuisance... gather some of the hunters... teach them a lesson...
string: ......暮光守衛開始強大起來......召集一些獵人......給他們一個教訓......

original: ...the clans think they're better than us... putting on airs... pah, they'll be the first to burn when the mortals get organized...
string: ......氏族以為他們比我們優秀......自以為是......哈，等到凡人組織起來後，他們會是第一批被抓去燒的......

original: ...just fed but still hungry... blood... all I can think about these days... last kill was so good... just the right amount of struggle...
string: ......才剛覓食但還是好餓......鮮血......這幾天腦子只能想到這個......上一個獵物很好......掙扎的程度恰到好處......

original: ...too much hiding... the mortals are weak... he's a coward to fear them, we should feed when we like... can't stand this hunger gnawing at me...
string: ......一直在躲藏......凡人很弱小......膽小鬼，幹嘛怕他們......我們餓了就要吸血......無法忍受被飢餓折磨......

original: I don't converse with my prey.
string: 我不跟食物交談。

original: Don't speak to me, meat.
string: 別跟我說話，食物。

original: Whoever did this is mine.
string: 犯下這事的人交給我處置。

original: Someone will bleed for this.
string: 有人會因此付出代價。

original: I will avenge you, brother.
string: 我會為你復仇的，兄弟。

original: I will avenge you, sister.
string: 我會為你復仇的，姐妹。

original: You had your chance to escape, vampire.
string: 你該跑的時候沒跑，吸血鬼。

original: You should have kept running.
string: 你應該繼續跑的。

original: Ha ha ha! I knew I'd find you.
string: 哈哈哈！就知道我會找到你。

original: Fool. You should have run.
string: 傻子。你應該逃跑的。

original: Now let's finish this.
string: 我們做個了結吧。

original: Hmm. Cowards.
string: 嗯。懦夫。

original: Must have run off.
string: 看來是跑掉了。

original: All quiet now.
string: 都安靜點。

original: I will find you.
string: 我會找到你的。

original: Running will warm your blood nicely.
string: 跑步會讓你的血加熱。

original: You don't think you can escape me, do you?
string: 你不會當真以為你跑得掉吧？

original: And so you learn the power of the night.
string: 你將見識到黑夜的力量。

original: Is that all of them?
string: 那些是全部了嗎？

original: That ends it.
string: 這樣就結束了。

original: And now for the feast.
string: 開始進行饗宴吧。

original: It's gone now.
string: 不見了。

original: The scent has gone cold.
string: 味道逐漸冷卻。

original: Hmm. Nothing.
string: 嗯。沒事。

original: I was hoping to feed.
string: 我以為我可以吸血。

original: Your blood will not protect you!
string: 你的血無法保護你！

original: It's the Dawnguard! Let none escape!
string: 是暮光守衛！別留活口！

original: When will you fools learn? The night is ours!
string: 你們這些傻子什麼時候才會學乖？夜晚是我們的！

original: I love it when dinner walks right into my arms.
string: 我真喜歡看到晚餐自己送上門來。

original: The prey is here!
string: 獵物在這！

original: You're mine!
string: 你是我的！

original: Die!
string: 死吧！

original: You dare to interfere with me?
string: 你居然敢干擾我？

original: I knew I smelled mortal blood!
string: 我就知道我聞到了凡人的血！

original: Now your blood is mine!
string: 你的血是我的！

original: Aha... and now you die.
string: 阿哈......死期到了。

original: Ha ha ha. Here you are.
string: 哈哈哈。你在這兒啊。

original: There you are.
string: 你在這兒啊。

original: ... what's that?
Something's not right.
string: 不太對勁。

original: We may feed again today.
string: 今天可以再進食一次。

original: There's something out there.
string: 有東西在附近。

original: Hmm?
string: 嗯？

original: There's no use hiding from me.
string: 在我面前躲起來是沒用的。

original: I'll find you, don't worry.
string: 我會找到你的，別擔心。

original: Where are you?
string: 你在哪裡？

original: Running is your only chance to live.
string: 想要活命就開始逃吧。

original: ...I'll find you...
I could feed again.
string: 我還想要再吸血。

original: Where are you?
string: 你在哪裡？

original: Soon... soon your blood will be mine...
string: 快了......你的血等下就是我的了......

original: Your blood calls me...
string: 你的血在呼喚我......

original: I'll drink you dry, mortal!
string: 我會把你榨乾，凡人......

original: Stop struggling. I'll give you a swift and beautiful death.
string: 別掙扎了。我會賞你快速美麗的死。

original: Why fight me? Your blood is already mine.
string: 為什麼要掙扎呢？你的血已經是我的了。

original: Your kind are finished.
string: 你跟你的同類要倒楣了。

original: Mortal fool, you can't stop us.
string: 凡人傻子，你是阻止不了我們的。

original: The night eternal awaits.
string: 夜晚永遠在等待。

original: You've seen your last dawn. I bring the night.
string: 你見不到下次黎明了。我帶來黑夜。

original: We own the night, fool.
string: 夜晚是我們的，傻子。

original: The night belongs to us.
string: 夜晚是我們的。

original: The Tyranny of the Sun has been broken!
string: 太陽的霸權被推翻了！

original: The sun cannot protect you any more!
string: 太陽再也無法保護你了！

original: Behold the power of Night!
string: 見識黑夜的力量！

original: This is my hunting ground.
string: 這裡是我的狩獵場。

original: You should not have come here, vampire.
string: 你不應該來的，吸血鬼。

original: There's no blood here for you.
string: 這裡的血跟你無緣。

original: You blood will not protect you from me.
string: 你的血是阻止不了我的。

original: Let me show you how mortal you still are, vampire.
string: 我來讓你見識一下你有多麼脆弱，吸血鬼。

original: You're no match for me, fledgling.
string: 你不是我的對手，小鳥兒。

original: Agh...
Ugh...
Hunh...
string: 嚇！

original: Gah...
Nuh...
No... my blood is strong...
string: 不......我的血是強大的......

original: Death is nothing to me...
string: 我沒把死亡看在眼裡......

original: I do not fear death.
string: 我不畏懼死亡。

original: Never... not yet...
Agh!
string: 啊！

original: Oof!
Nargh!
string: 嗯呀！

original: Argh!
string: 呀呃！

original: Weergh!
string: 噢！

original: Yeagh!
string: 耶！

original: Is that your best, mortal?
string: 你就只有這點能耐嗎，凡人？

original: You dare defy me?
string: 你居然敢違抗我？

original: Now it's my turn.
string: 輪到我啦。

original: Hhyyaarargghhhh!
string: 呵呀呀呀！

original: Rrrraaaaarrggghhhh!
string: 噢噢啊啊啊！

original: Yyyaaaarrgghh!
string: 咿呀呀呀呀！

original: Aaaayyyaarrrrgghh!
string: 啊呀呀呀啊！

original: Nnyyyaarrgghh!
string: 嗯呀呀呀呀

original: Yearrgh!
string: 耶啊啊！

original: Hyargh!
string: 嘿呀！

original: Rrarggh!
string: 噢啊！

original: Aggghh!
string: 啊啊啊！

original: Grrargh!
string: 啊啊！

original: Ssssss!
string: 嘶！

original: Bleed and die!
string: 流光你的血液吧！

original: Just a taste...
You're mine, mortal!
string: 你是我的，凡人！

original: Pah, your blood is foul.
string: 你的血是臭的。

original: Nice castle you've got here.
string: 你的城堡滿漂亮的啊。

original: I've spent years cleaning the place up and making repairs. You can be damn sure the vampires won't be burning this place down.
string: 我花了好多年在清理跟維修上面。我跟你保證吸血鬼不會把這裡燒掉的。

original: Tolan said you're a vampire hunter.
string: 杜蘭跟我說你是吸血鬼獵人。

original: That's right. I used to be a Vigilant, but we had a difference of opinion.
string: 沒錯，我原本是警戒者，但是我們後來意見相左。

original: They didn't think Skyrim has a vampire problem, and I did.
string: 他們不認為天際省有吸血鬼，我認為有。

original: Kind of fitting that the Vigilants would be wiped out by vampires.
string: 現在警戒者都被吸血鬼殺光了，自作孽不可活啊。

original: She's asking me to take her home, to some castle.
string: 她要我帶她回家，去某座城堡。

original: I won't lie - if this were any other situation, I'd put her down just on the chance she might be a vampire.
string: 不瞞你說，別的時候我可能會直接把她殺了，她可能是吸血鬼，這不能冒任何險。

original: But this is something different. I'd say do what she wants. Take her home, and see who else is in this castle.
string: 但是現在情況不太一樣。建議你聽她的。帶她回家然後看城堡內還有什麼人。

original: It seems they were looking for a woman who was sealed in a crypt.
string: 他們好像在找一個被封印在墓穴裡的女人。

original: That doesn't make much sense. Where is this woman? Who is she?
string: 這沒道理啊。那女人在哪裡？她是誰？

original: So, any luck? Was Tolan right about the vampires being interested in Dimhollow Crypt?
string: 如何，有什麼發現嗎？杜蘭說吸血鬼對暗洞墓穴很感興趣，這句話有說錯嗎？

original: What do you have against the Vigilants?
string: 你對警戒者為什麼那麼反感？

original: Isn't it obvious? They're soft, the lot of them.
string: 不是很明顯嗎？他們軟弱，全都一個樣。

original: Totally unprepared for any real threat. And yet I was the one ridiculed for trying to be ready for anything.
string: 面對任何實質的威脅都毫無準備。我想做好萬全準備還要被嘲笑。

original: "Too extreme", they called me. Well, that doesn't seem to have worked out in their favor, now has it?
string: 他們說我「太極端了」。現在看來他們錯得真離譜，你說對不對？

original: It's not safe out there. Horrible creatures attacking towns in the night... If they won't let me in, at least I can stay here.
string: 外面太危險了。夜晚的時候會有恐怖的怪物攻擊城鎮。就算他們不讓我進去，至少我還能待在這裡。

original: Look at the size of that fort. They must have room for a few more in there.
string: 你看那堡壘的規模。裡面一定還有房間可以容納我們。

original: I worry it'll never be safe to go home.
string: 回家太不安全了。

original: If the Dawnguard can't stop these vampires, who can?
string: 如果連暮光守衛都阻止不了吸血鬼，誰還有機會？

original: I hope Alvide doesn't think less of me, but I can't protect her on my own. We're safer here.
string: 希望亞薇德不會看不起我，但是我自己無法保護她。我們待在這裡較安全。

original: Why can't they just let us in? We won't get in the way!
string: 為什麼他們不能放我們進去？我們不會礙事的！

original: I've no love for living out of a tent, but I'll take that over being ripped apart.
string: 我當然不想住在帳篷裡啊，可是我更不想要被撕成兩半。

original: It looks like this is as close as we're going to get being safe from the vampires.
string: 看來這裡已經是我們能夠找到最安全的地方了。

original: Barknar insisted we come here, said we'd be safe. He also said we'd be inside the walls.
string: 巴克納堅持要我們來這裡，說這裡很安全。但他也說我們會住進城堡裡。

original: What if the vampires come here, after the Dawnguard? We'll be stuck right in the middle.
string: 要是吸血鬼來這裡找暮光守衛怎麼辦？我們會剛好卡在中間。

original: I hope we can go home soon. I don't like it here.
string: 希望我們可以早日回家。我不喜歡這裡。

original: At least Barknar and I are here together.
string: 至少我跟巴克納都在這裡。

original: Thought I'd come here to be safe. Now they won't so much as let us in.
string: 我以為來這裡就安全了。怎曉得他們根本不放我們進去。

original: How hard would it be to feed a few extra mouths? I'm sure they can manage, and not leave us sitting out here like cattle.
string: 要多餵飽幾個人很困難嗎？我確定他們做得到，但是他們卻把我們像牲畜一樣鎖在外頭。

original: I won't beg for protection, but I'm not even sure that would work with this Isran.
string: 我不會哀求人來保護我。但是哀求伊士冉那人應該也沒用。

original: Aren't the Dawnguard here to help, to make it safe for us? Can't see why they wouldn't let us in.
string: 暮光守衛不是來幫忙的嗎？要保護我們的安危？不懂為什麼他們不讓我們進去。

original: I've killed the Dawnguard leaders.
string: 我殺了暮光守衛的領袖。

original: Excellent. That should prevent the problem from escalating.
string: 非常好，如此一來問題就不會擴大。

original: Though they are a rebellious and determined lot. While you've severed the snake's head, the body will likely writhe a while longer.
string: 他們那群人意志堅定而且難以控制。儘管你把蛇的頭給砍斷了，牠的身體還是會扭曲一陣子。

original: Good. That should slow them down.
string: 很好，這下應該可以減緩他們的速度。

original: But, we haven't gotten rid of them completely. A body can rattle around confused long after it's head's been severed.
string: 可是我們還沒有徹底瓦解他們。就算把頭砍掉了，身體還是會持續扭動。

original: Understood.
string: 了解。

original: Good.
string: 很好。

original: They've holed up in an abandoned fort in the Reach.
string: 他們躲在邊塞領的一個廢棄堡壘中。

original: Killing their leaders should discourage them from an out and out war with us.
string: 殺死他們的領袖可以遏止他們對我們全面開戰。

original: Good.
string: 很好。

original: They've holed up in an abandoned fort in the Reach.
string: 他們躲在邊塞領的一個廢棄堡壘中。

original: Kill their leaders. That should put a stop to a full out war.
string: 殺死他們的領袖，讓他們無法全面開戰。

original: But their time has come to an end. And you will be the one that ends it.
string: 但是他們的時代終將落幕。而你將會促成這一切的發生。

original: Who are the Dawnguard?
string: 暮光守衛是什麼人？

original: What can I do to help?
string: 我可以幫上什麼忙？

original: The Dawnguard will, no doubt, soon become even more of a nuisance now that Auriel's Bow has been recovered.
string: 奧麗瑞的弓被找到之後，那些暮光守衛肯定會比之前還要煩人。

original: We need to strike a crippling blow against them before they muster more men against us.
string: 趁他們招募更多人之前，我們就必須給他們致命的一擊。

original: The Dawnguard will want the Bow, and they will fight us, hard, to get it.
string: 暮光守衛想要那把弓。為了弓他們會不惜跟我們一戰。

original: We should strike them first before they can muster a larger force.
string: 趁他們尚未集結人馬之前，我們要先下手為強。

original: Perhaps you still need convincing? Behold the power!
string: 也許這樣我會更有說服力？見證我的力量吧！

original: Wait, please! Don't leave me for the wolves to find!
string: 拜託你，等等！別讓狼群把我叼走。

original: North, I think, then they turned west and that's the last I saw of them.
string: 應該是朝北，接著往西。那是我最後一次看到他們。

original: They mentioned some place called Dimhollow Crypt, but I don't know where that is.
string: 他們提到一個叫做暗洞墓穴的地方，但是我不知道那在哪裡。

original: While you're looking for the vampires, I'll try to get us some help. Come find me at Dead Drop Falls when you've learned more.
string: 你去找吸血鬼，我去試著找人幫忙。你找到你要的資訊就來死落瀑布找我。

original: My family's home is west of Solitude. If you help me get back there, they'll be grateful to you.
string: 我跟家人住在獨孤城的西邊。你要是可以協助我回去的話，他們會感激你的。

original: Someday, we'll rebuild the Hall of the Vigilant. Mark my words, I'll see it done before they put me in the ground.
string: 總有一天，我們會重建警戒者之家。記得我說的，我會在他們殺了我之前完成這件事。

original: Vampires are worse than Daedra. I wish we Vigilants had taken them more seriously while we we had the chance.
string: 吸血鬼比魔族還糟。真希望我們這些警戒者在當時還有能力的時候有正視這個問題。

original: One thing about living in Skyrim I could never stomach... all the damn vampires!
string: 我住在天際省有一件事總是無法忍受。就是那一堆該死的吸血鬼！

original: There will be time to honor the fallen later. For now, we've got to put a stop to these vampires.
string: 我們日後再緬懷這些死者。但是現在，我們必須阻止那些吸血鬼。

original: Stendarr watch over you.
string: 願斯坦德爾保佑你。

original: Thanks again for saving my life.
string: 再次謝謝你救了我一命。

original: Something tells me the divines favor you, my friend.
string: 我感覺得出來諸神眷顧著你，我的朋友。

original: Of course there are. Most of us spend our lives as nomads, traveling from place to place in our endless war against evil.
string: 他們當然在眷顧我。我們大多數的人都是游牧民族，從一個地方移動到下一個地方，進行我們與邪惡之間的永恆戰役。

original: I wish I could say how many we numbered, but only a privileged few knew that, and they're dead now.
string: 我真希望我知道我們的數量，但是只有幾個人知道。那幾個人也都死了。

original: I wish I could say it was courage, or skill at arms that saved me. But that would be a lie.
string: 我真希望我可以大聲地說，是勇氣或是我使用武器的技巧救了我一命。但是那會是謊言。

original: No, I am alive only because the vampires spared me.
string: 不，我活著是因為吸血鬼饒了我一命。

original: It seems they wanted to send a message to the other Vigilants still walking the roads of Skyrim.
string: 看來他們想要給天際省的其他警戒者一個訊息。

original: If was a foolish mistake, and I intend to make sure they learn that the hard way.
string: 那是個愚蠢的錯誤，我打算讓他們狠狠學到教訓。

original: The Hall was a place of respite, learning and comradeship, where a road-weary brother or sister could rest for a time in peace and comfort.
string: 警戒者之家是大家休息、學習跟交流的地方。旅途疲憊的兄弟姐妹們可以在一個平靜又舒適的地方休息一陣子。

original: Most of our learning could be found there. We always studied our enemies, so we might better learn how to defeat them.
string: 我們累積的知識都在那裡。我們總是不斷學習我們的敵人，這樣才知道如何擊敗他們。

original: But of course, those days are gone now.
string: 但是那些日子都已經是過去式了。

original: The Vigilants mostly hunt down daedra worshippers, which is why they got torn to pieces when they went up against vampires.
string: 警戒者大多只會獵捕魔族崇拜者，所以遇到真的吸血鬼只剩下被撕成碎片的分。

original: That's why our leader Isran is reestablishing the Dawnguard. Real, serious vampire hunters.
string: 所以我們的領袖，伊士冉，才會重新建立暮光守衛。我們才是真正的吸血鬼獵人。

original: Land on the ground, and I will have more to teach you.
string: 降落到地面吧，我還有更多要教你的。

original: Cease your flight and we will move on to the next lesson.
string: 不要再飛了。我們準備好進入下一個課題。

original: Where do you want to go?
string: 你要去哪裡？

original: We should check back with Isran.
string: 我們應該跟伊士冉回報。

original: I don't even know who that is...
string: 我根本就不知道那是誰......

original: And frankly, I need to get home to figure out what's happening.
string: 而且，我應該回家好好想想發生了什麼事。

original: Yes, he definitely sounds like he knows what to do.
string: 他聽起來真的知道該怎麼做。

original: If you want to waste your time, that's fine. But I've got my own destination in mind. Maybe you could help me get there when you're done?
string: 你如果想要浪費時間的話，就去吧。但是我還有自己的目的地要去。也許你弄完之後可以協助我。

original: Maybe he knows what's going on.
string: 也許他知道發生了什麼事。

original: Look, I'm happy to help you run any errands you need to, but I've got my own destination. Could you help me get there whenever we're done?
string: 聽著。我很樂意跟你到處跑腿，但是我還有自己的目的地要去。我們結束之後你能幫我抵達嗎？

original: Never.
string: 不可能。

original: Very well then, you leave me no choice!
string: 很好，是你令我別無選擇！

original: Enough of this!
string: 夠了。

original: Yes, quite. I'm growing weary of speaking to you and my traitorous daughter.
string: 對，真的夠了。我已經懶得跟你還有我那叛徒女兒說話了。

original: I'll give you a single chance to turn over the bow to me. There will not be a second.
string: 我給你一次機會，讓你把弓交給我。不會有第二次機會了。

original: The bow belongs to me now.
string: 奧麗瑞的弓屬於我。

original: Finally, a trace of honesty in our little conversation.
string: 你終於開始講真話了。

original: How does it feel to hold the fate of the vampire in your grasp. Exhilarating, isn't it?
string: 把吸血鬼的命運握在手上感覺如何？很興奮，對吧？

original: No, I'm here to prevent our annihilation.
string: 不，我是來避免我族的滅亡。

original: Ah, I see you've been speaking to Valerica and she's convinced you that eternal night will plunge us into war with daytime dwellers.
string: 啊，看來你跟瓦雷莉卡談過，也被說服了。以為永恆的夜晚會導致日行者與我族之間的戰爭。

original: If only it were so. With the world in shadow, we would never tire, never weaken... more than a match for their pitiful armies.
string: 事情不會那樣發展。當世界陷入陰影之後，我們再也不會感到疲倦，我們不會感到虛弱......他們可悲的軍隊不會是我們的對手。

original: I would never use Serana like that.
string: 我永遠不會那樣利用瑟拉娜。

original: The vampire is eternal, and with immortality comes the revelation that these bonds never endure... it's fleeting, momentary at best.
string: 吸血鬼是永生的。有了永恆，你將了解任何誓約都經不起考驗......都一閃即逝，頂多是一時的。

original: This is about more than killing vampires.
string: 這不單是跟殺死吸血鬼有關。

original: Ah, of course. The prophecy. You've come here to stop me from taking Auriel's Bow and shrouding the world in darkness.
string: 啊，當然，還有預言。你是來阻止我用奧麗瑞的弓，把整個世界壟罩在黑暗之中。

original: I'm only here to kill you.
string: 我是來殺你的。

original: I see. Interesting that you can set aside your morals when it suits you.
string: 原來如此。你隨時可以拋棄你的道德這件事讓我感到很有趣。

original: I would never harm Serana. She's too important to me.
string: 我永遠不會傷害瑟拉娜。她對我而言太重要了。

original: Then my daughter is truly lost. She died the moment she accepted a mortal into her life.
string: 我的女兒真的離我而去了。當她接受一個凡人進入她的生命時，她就已經死了。

original: Yes, yes. Always the noble vampire hunter.
string: 是的，是的。高貴的吸血鬼獵人總是這麼說。

original: And what happens when you've slain me? Is Valerica next? Is Serana?
string: 你殺死我之後呢？接著殺瓦雷莉卡？還是瑟拉娜？

original: Your kind is a blight on this world.
string: 你們的存在汙染這世界。

original: Oh, come now... spare me your notions of kinship.
string: 喔，拜託......我才懶得聽你對血族關係的看法。

original: You've simply used Serana in an attempt to take away what should rightfully be mine.
string: 你只不過利用瑟拉娜試圖奪走我應得的。

original: You're an insult to our kind.
string: 你是我族的恥辱。

original: And you...
string: 至於你呢......

original: No...
Because unlike her, I'm not afraid of you. Not anymore.
string: 我跟她不一樣。我不再畏懼你了。

original: So, I see this dragon has fangs.
string: 原來這隻龍長牙了。

original: Your voice drips with the venom of your mother's influence. How alike you've become.
string: 從妳的話語中，我聽得出來妳已經被妳的母親給同化了。妳們變得好像。

original: No more. I'm done with you.
string: 不要說了。我跟你無話可說了。

original: Provided for me? Are you insane?
string: 給我的一切？你瘋了嗎？

original: You've destroyed our family. You've killed other vampires. All over some prophecy that we barely understand.
string: 你摧毀了我們的家庭。你殺了其他的吸血鬼。只為了一個我們根本不了解的預言。

original: Of course I do.
string: 我當然知道。

original: You disappoint me, Serana. You've taken everything I provided for you and thrown it all away for this... pathetic being.
string: 妳真令我失望，瑟拉娜。妳把我給妳一切都拋諸腦後，只為了這一個......可悲的東西。

original: Of course I do.
string: 我當然知道。

original: You disappoint me, Serana. You've taken everything I provided for you and thrown it all away for this... pathetic half-breed vampire.
string: 妳真令我失望，瑟拉娜。妳把我給妳的一切都拋諸腦後，只為了這一個......可悲的雜種吸血鬼。

original: You know why we're here.
string: 你知道我們為何而來。

original: Serana, my darling. I see you still favor keeping a pet.
string: 瑟拉娜，親愛的。看來妳還是喜歡養寵物啊。

original: So, you've returned.
string: 看來妳回來了。

original: Is your... pet keeping you entertained?
string: 妳的......寵物有討妳歡心嗎？

original: What now, Isran?
string: 怎麼了，伊士冉？

original: It's time we take the fight to their door.
string: 我們要殺到他們家裡去了。

original: Gather your things and rest well, my friend. We meet outside Castle Volkihar.
string: 收拾你們的東西，好好休息吧，我的朋友。我們弗基哈爾城堡前見。

original: The prophecy is no more!
string: 預言結束了！

original: Send the troll after them!
string: 讓巨魔去對付他們！

original: This is the time of the Dawnguard!
string: 這是暮光守衛表現的時刻！

original: For too long we've allowed these vampires to poison the night and kill our people! Now, we finally have the means to strike back!
string: 那些吸血鬼荼毒夜晚、殘害我們的同胞已經夠久了。現在我們終於有辦法反攻了！

original: We now have Auriel's Bow. The gods themselves have favored us and we must answer with action!
string: 我們現在有奧麗瑞的弓！就連諸神都眷顧著我們，我們必須用行動來回應！

original: The time has come to finally put an end to Harkon and his unholy prophecy!
string: 我們要終結赫岡以及他那不潔的預言！

original: We will march on their lair and destroy those wretched abominations so they can no longer corrupt our world!
string: 我們要前進到他們的巢穴，摧毀那些令人憎惡的東西，讓他們再也無法腐化我們的世界！

original: This is our fight and this is our fate!
string: 就是這一戰！決定我們的命運！

original: Come on then, we haven't got all day!
string: 來吧。別浪費時間了。

original: I trust her to do the right thing.
string: 我相信她會做正確的事。

original: I suppose that's as much as I can hope for.
string: 你都這樣說，我也只能接受了。

original: Let me address the Dawnguard, and then we'll be off. The men deserve to know that we've finally gained the upper hand.
string: 讓我跟暮光守衛說幾句話，我們就出發。大夥必須知道我們終於佔上風了。

original: We need your help, Isran.
string: 我們需要你的幫忙，伊士冉。

original: Indeed. The day hasn't been won while Harkon still walks Tamriel.
string: 確實。只要赫岡還在世上，就不算成功。

original: But what of Serana? Can she be trusted to lift a blade against her own kind? Her own family?
string: 但是瑟拉娜呢？她會願意殺死同類嗎？她自己的家人？

original: Then let's face him, together.
string: 那我們一起面對他吧。

original: Thank you. Somehow I knew you'd understand.
string: 謝謝你。我就知道你能理解。

original: No. He has to die. We have no choice.
string: 不。他必須死。我們別無選擇。

original: We should honor our agreement with him.
string: 我們應該遵守跟他的約定。

original: Are you out of your mind?
string: 你的頭殼壞掉了嗎？

original: The moment you hand over the bow your usefulness ends. He'll kill you and then he'll take my blood for the damn prophecy.
string: 你一旦把弓交給他，你就毫無價值可言了。他會把你殺了，然後拿我的血完成那該死的預言。

original: We have the bow, he'll listen to us.
string: 弓在我們手上，他會聽我們的。

original: Have you been paying attention to everything that's happened? He'll betray us the second our backs are turned.
string: 經歷了這些事情，難道你還沒有領悟嗎？他隨時都可能背叛我們。

original: Then we kill him, before he kills us.
string: 那我們就先下手為強，把他殺了。

original: I keep thinking that there's got to be another way, but he'll turn on us both the moment he gets the chance.
string: 我一直在思索其他的方法。但事實是，他一有機會就會背叛我們。

original: Then let's face him, together.
string: 那我們一起面對他吧。

original: If we head back to the castle and kick the front door in, we're going to be knee-deep in his friends.
string: 如果我們返回城堡然後從正門進入。會被他的朋友們圍剿。

original: Let's head back to Isran and let him see what we've got first. I'm betting he'll lend us a sword or two.
string: 我們先去找伊士冉看看他怎麼說。我敢打賭他會借我們些人手。

original: No. This has to end here and now.
string: 不。我們現在便得要做個了結。

original: Let's run as far from him as we can.
string: 我們跑吧，跑得越遠越好。

original: There's nowhere to run. And I'm certainly not moving in with my mother, if that's what your implying.
string: 要跑去哪裡。你不會是在暗示要我跟我媽住吧？我才不要。

original: Maybe we can reason with him.
string: 也許我們可以說服他。

original: Have you been paying attention? It's obvious my father's well beyond reason.
string: 你有在專心聽嗎？你無法跟我父親講道理。

original: If we do, he'll have to die.
string: 如果我們那樣做的話，他就必須得死。

original: I've been thinking about this for a long time.
string: 我想這件事想很久了。

original: It's... it's not easy. But I don't think we have much of a choice.
string: 這......不容易。但是我們別無選擇。

original: Little patience for talk? Good. Let's end this!
string: 沒耐心繼續說嗎？那好，現在做個了結吧！

original: Auriel's power is ours!
string: 奧麗瑞的力量是我們的！

original: All of Skyrim will tremble before us.
string: 全天際省都將在我們面前顫抖！

original: Now the whole world will fall at our feet.
string: 整個世界都將是我們的！

original: You have the bow...
string: 弓在你手上......

original: Auriel's Bow. Well done, indeed.
string: 奧麗瑞的弓。做得好。非常好。

original: I knew you would be victorious.
string: 我就知道你會成功。

original: Who'll need thralls when the very sun is at our mercy?
string: 連太陽都要跪在我們面前時，誰還需要奴僕？

original: You've served us all well, friend.
string: 你幫我們很大的忙，朋友。

original: For the Dawnguard! For Skyrim!
string: 為了暮光守衛！為了天際省！

original: Find their leader and kill him!
string: 找到他們的領袖然後殺了他！

original: Leave no vampire in one piece!
string: 所有吸血鬼都得死！

original: Arkay and I will take care of the little ones! You find the leader!
string: 阿凱爾跟我會處理小隻的。你去找領袖。

original: We'll secure the castle. You just get to their master!
string: 我們會鞏固城堡。你去找他們的主人。

original: Kill their leader before it has a chance to escape!
string: 趁他逃跑之前殺死他們的領袖。

original: Find all of them! Don't let any of them get away!
string: 找到所有人！別讓任何一個跑掉！

original: Destroy every last one of them!
string: 摧毀他們所有人！

original: It's time to end this.
string: 該是做個了結了。

original: The trolls will serve us well, I think.
string: 我想巨魔會是一大利器。

original: Arkay says we're going to win this. Well, probably.
string: 阿凱爾說我們終能勝出。應該。

original: I'm as ready as I can be.
string: 我一直都準備好了。

original: We have Auriel's Bow. We can't lose... right?
string: 我們有奧麗瑞的弓。我們不可能輸吧？

original: We'll make sure there's nothing left of them.
string: 我們一定會殲滅他們。

original: It is time for action.
string: 該是行動的時候了。

original: You will not touch him.
string: 別想碰他。

original: You will not touch her.
string: 別想碰她

original: Are there other Vigilants still out there?
string: 還有警戒者在外頭嗎？

original: You said something happened to the Hall of Vigilants?
string: 你說警戒者之家出事了？

original: Yes. By destroying it, the vampires hoped to cripple our order's activities in Skyrim.
string: 沒錯。吸血鬼以為只要摧毀掉警戒者之家，就能瓦解我們在天際省的行動。

original: I'm sure Lord Harkon will be most pleased with your efforts. Find him at once.
string: 我確定赫岡大人會對你的行為感到很高興。立刻去見他吧。

original: Don't keep our master waiting. Take him the bow immediately.
string: 別讓我們的主人等待。立刻把弓拿給他。

original: Find Lord Harkon. Let him know the time of the prophecy is at hand.
string: 去找赫岡領主。讓他知道預言即將實現。

original: Present the bow to Lord Harkon at once!
string: 立刻把弓獻給赫岡大人。

original: I'm sure your reward will be great for ensuring our Lord's success.
string: 你確保了我們主人的戰果，你的報酬一定會很可觀。

original: Go find Lord Harkon. Tell him of your success.
string: 去找赫岡領主。跟他說你的成果。

original: Our Lord will be most pleased, I'm sure. I knew you could do it.
string: 我們的主人會很高興的，我很確定。我就知道你辦得到。

original: Auriel's Bow is ours. Deliver it to Lord Harkon at once, so we can reap the benefits of this prophecy.
string: 奧麗瑞的弓是我們的了。立刻把它拿給赫岡領主。我們將要收割預言的果實了。

original: There must be something you want.
string: 你一定有想要的東西。

original: I'll tell you what. I appreciate what you're trying to do, so I'll play along.
string: 跟你說，我感謝你的好意，所以我就配合你吧。

original: The only thing I see around here in abundance are soul husks. You know, those ugly fungus-looking things growing out of the ground.
string: 這裡唯一數量很多的東西是靈魂莢。你知道吧？那些在地面上長得像菌類的醜東西。

original: Bring me say... twenty-five of them, and you can rummage through what was left on my cart.
string: 帶給我......二十五個好了。你就可以選一樣我車子上的東西。

original: A spell tome. (25 husks)
string: 我要一本魔法書卷。（25個靈魂莢）

original: Sure. Here you go. Can't understand a word of it, maybe it will do you some good.
string: 可以。拿去。我一個字也看不懂。你拿去也許有用。

original: Fair enough. What do you have?
string: 聽起來很划算。你都賣些什麼？

original: Odds and ends I've gathered over the years. Well, used to gather before all of this nonsense happened to me.
string: 都是這些年來收集到的各種東西。嗯，正確來說，都是這個鬧劇發生之前收集來的東西。

original: Tell me what you're looking for and maybe we can make a deal... if you have the husks.
string: 跟我說你想要什麼，也許我們可以做個交易......前提是你必須要有靈魂莢。

original: I know, and I'm sorry that happened. But now...
string: 我知道。發生這種事情我也很抱歉。只是現在......

original: They threw me out, Tolan!
string: 他們把我趕了出去，杜蘭！

original: I'm going to hold onto it.
string: 我還是自己留著好了。

original: If you're holding out for more gold, it's never going to happen.
string: 如果你是為了賣更多錢的話，就別作夢了。

original: Deal. (Give Book)
string: 成交。（交出書）

original: Here you go.
string: 拿去吧。

original: I have another ancient falmer tome.
string: 我還有一本上古伐莫族書卷。

original: My offer is still a thousand. Did you want to sell?
string: 我出的價錢依舊是一千金幣。你有要賣嗎？

original: Let me think about it.
string: 讓我考慮看看。

original: Suit yourself. I'm not going anywhere.
string: 隨你便。我人都在這裡。

original: Deal. (Give Book)
string: 成交。（交出書）

original: Here you go.
string: 拿去吧。

original: Depends how much you're paying.
string: 看你願意付多少錢。

original: Well, considering no one else in Skyrim would buy something they couldn't possibly read, I'd say you don't have much of a choice.
string: 整個天際省沒有人會想買一本他們無法閱讀的書。我想你別無選擇。

original: Tell you what, you bring me books like this, and I'll pay a thousand gold each. I'll even throw in a translated edition I have for free. Interested?
string: 我跟你說，你帶這種書回來給我。我一本就付你一千金幣。我還會再免費給你一本翻譯過後的版本。有興趣嗎？

original: Any interest in ancient falmer tomes?
string: 你對古老的伐莫書卷有興趣嗎？

original: Well, well. I haven't seen one of these beauties in a long time. A rare find in the original falmer language.
string: 真是特別啊。我已經很久沒有看過這種書了。這本非常稀有因為是用原始的伐莫族語書寫的。

original: You're damn right I'm interested. Question is, are you selling?
string: 我當然有興趣。問題是，你有要賣嗎？

original: For me? I've done what I set out to do.
string: 我嗎？我已經完成了我的目標。

original: But you... take that out into the world. And if anyone asks, tell them what we discovered. Together.
string: 但是你......把這帶回世界。如果有人問起的話，就跟他說我們的發現。我們一起的發現。

original: What now?
string: 現在呢？

original: Is there any more Aetherium?
string: 還有更多的神光水晶嗎？

original: Make it count. This may be the only chance we ever get to use the Forge.
string: 謹慎使用。這可能是我們使用熔爐的唯一一次機會。

original: And with that... it's done. No one could possibly deny what we've found now.
string: 有了這個......就大功告成了。沒有任何人能夠否定我們的發現。

original: Begone! You're not welcome here!
string: 離去吧！你不受歡迎！

original: Lady Serana's back! Open the gate!
string: 瑟拉娜大小姐回來了！把門打開！

original: That's all I wanted to ask.
string: 我只想知道這些。

original: Very well.
string: 很好。

original: What else do you want to know?
string: 你還想知道什麼事情？

original: There are some things I want to ask you about.
string: 有些事情我想要問你。

original: You have earned my trust, so I will share what I can.
string: 你贏得我的信賴，我願意跟你分享我知道的。

original: DialogueFerrySystemIdle
string: DialogueFerrySystemIdle

original: Windhelm eh? City of kings, they say. Hope you packed warm though.
string: 風舵城，是嗎？他們說是君王之城。希望你帶的衣服夠暖和。

original: Ah, Solitude. Best port in Skyrim. You should try the Spiced Mead while you're there.
string: 啊，獨孤城。天際省最棒的港口。你在那邊應該喝喝看烈蜜酒。

original: Dawnstar doesn't have much of a port, but the miners say its got rich ore veins.
string: 晨星城的港口不怎麼樣，但是那裡的礦工說那當地的礦脈非常豐富。

original: They say anyone who steps foot on that island will meet an early death... hope you know what you're doing.
string: 聽人說凡是踏上那座島的人都會早死......希望你知道自己在做什麼。

original: While I doubt we'll ever be truly rid of vampires in Skyrim, you've certainly made it a much safer place for now.
string: 我不認為我們有辦法完全根絕天際省的吸血鬼問題，但是可以確定的是，你把這個地方變得比原本安全許多。

original: I'm proud of what we've managed to accomplish.
string: 我對於我們的成就感到驕傲。

original: Let's get back to work.
string: 回去工作吧。

original: I sense the power of the ancient blood in your veins. It has made you strong.
string: 我感受到上古之血在你血管中的力量。你變得很強大。

original: I have kept my end of the bargain, now I expect you to keep yours.
string: 我履行了我的承諾。現在輪到你了。

original: Do as I command, and you will reap the rewards. Defy me, and I can offer you only pain and suffering.
string: 照我說的做，你就能收割成果。違背我，我就讓你感受到痛苦跟受難。

original: Can you feel the power of the ancient blood coursing through your veins?
string: 你感覺得到上古之血在你體內流竄嗎？

original: Remember, you are no mere vampire. You are something far greater.
string: 記得，你不是一般的吸血鬼。你偉大許多。

original: Do not forget the price of your new power. I expect your complete obedience.
string: 別忘了取得能力要償還的代價。我期待你完全服從我。

original: Will you be a hunter, or will you be prey?
string: 你會成為獵人，還是獵物？

original: It was no mere chance that brought you to me. It was destiny.
string: 你我相遇不是運氣。是命運。

original: You are welcome here... for now.
string: 我們暫且歡迎你......

original: You've been given a great gift. Do not squander it.
string: 你得到了一份偉大的禮物。別浪費了。

original: As a king is to his subjects, so you are to other vampires.
string: 人類侍奉它們的國王，而吸血鬼將侍奉你。

original: Revel in your new powers, but do not forget who gave them to you.
string: 陶醉於你新的能力之中，但是別忘了是誰給你的。

original: Go on, get out of here!
string: 別逗留，離開這裡。

original: You're not welcome here.
string: 你在這裡不受歡迎。

original: Go away! We don't suffer trespassers!
string: 離開這裡。我們不歡迎入侵者。

original: Lord Harkon's a great man. Best show him the proper respect.
string: 赫岡是個偉大的人。最好給予他應得的尊重。

original: I watch the gate. Ain't much else to tell.
string: 我負責看門。僅此而已。

original: After all these years, Lady Serana's back. Now that's something.
string: 過了那麼多年，瑟拉娜大小姐居然回來了。今天是什麼日子啊？

original: Way I hear it, Lady Serana's been gone a real long time.
string: 據我所知，瑟拉娜小姐消失了很長一段時間。

original: Look at them... they've definitely taken a liking to you.
string: 看看牠們......牠們一定很喜歡你。

original: And unless I'm seeing things, you're starting to... glimmer.
string: 是我眼花了還是你真的在......發亮。

original: Hope the moths like that bark as much as Dexion said they would.
string: 希望那些飛蛾有如戴希翁所說的那樣喜歡樹皮。

original: Well, we got the knife... now all we need to do is track down one of those Canticle Trees.
string: 嗯，我們拿到刮刀了，現在只需要找到一顆頌歌之樹。

original: Carefully gather the bark? How?
string: 小心地剝開樹皮？要怎麼做？

original: Carefully gather the bark? How?
string: 小心地剝開樹皮？要怎麼做？

original: What went wrong?
string: 哪裡出錯了？

original: Deciphering one of the Elder Scrolls is nothing like reading a simple book. There's quite a bit of ritual and concentration required.
string: 解讀一本上古卷軸跟閱讀一般的書籍差很多。需要先完成一些儀式，還得保持專注。

original: It can take months or even years to complete a single scroll and even then, months to recover.
string: 要閱讀一卷可能得花上數個月甚至數年的時間。就算閱讀完了也要花幾個月的時間來復原。

original: Is it normal for Moth Priests to go blind?
string: 先祖蛾祭司都會瞎掉嗎？

original: Sadly, yes. It's the inevitable fate we agree to pursue when reading the Elder Scrolls.
string: 很遺憾，但是沒錯。我們都同意踏上這條不歸路，為了閱讀上古卷軸。

original: It generally doesn't occur until a Moth Priest is in his latter years, but in my case I simply wasn't preparing myself properly.
string: 通常這只會在先祖蛾祭司的晚年才會發生。而我簡單來說就是沒做好準備。

original: Then how do I even stand a chance?
string: 這樣我有可能成功嗎？

original: You've come this far, and you've found several Elder Scrolls.
string: 您成功地走到了這一步，還找到了好幾部上古卷軸。

original: Whether you believe it or not, the scrolls have a mind of their own. If they didn't want you to find them, they wouldn't allow it.
string: 信不信由您，但是卷軸是有意志的。如果它們不想要被您找到，您是找不到的。

original: Because of this, I strongly believe you were meant to hear the ancestral chorus. Only one way to find out.
string: 也因為如此，我才深信您註定要聽到古老的歌頌。要找出答案也只有一條路可走。

original: How does that help the Moth Priest?
string: 那對先祖蛾祭司有什麼幫助？

original: By having the Ancestor Moths close to the Moth Priest, they can utilize the conduit and share the moth's augury.
string: 讓先祖飛蛾靠近祭司，他們就能透過這個管道來聆聽飛蛾的占卜。

original: Only the most resilient of priests can do it this way... it takes years of practice to interpret the harmony.
string: 只有最強大的祭司才辦得到。那旋律需要多年的練習才能解讀。

original: Moths barely make a sound, let alone speak.
string: 飛蛾幾乎不會發出聲音，更別說是開口說話。

original: Oh, the moths don't literally read the scrolls... but they maintain a connection to ancient magic that allows the Moth Priests to decipher them.
string: 喔，飛蛾不會當真念出卷軸的內容。牠們僅是跟古老的魔法維持著某種連結，而先祖蛾祭司有辦法解讀它們。

original: If you listen closely when you find the glade, you should be able to hear their song... a soft, harmonious trilling.
string: 等您找到林地的時候，您就應該聽得到牠們的歌聲。一種柔和、和諧的顫音。

original: It's through this ancestral chorus that the moths tap into a form of primal augur and become a conduit for deciphering the scrolls.
string: 那些飛蛾透過古老的歌唱傳達出某種原始的占卜結果，也因此成為解讀卷軸的管道。

original: How's a moth related to the Elder Scrolls?
string: 先祖蛾跟卷軸有什麼關聯？

original: Well, as I'm sure you've figured out by now, it's no mere coincidence that we're named "Moth Priests."
string: 啊，我以為您已經猜出來了。我們被稱之為「先祖蛾祭司」不是隨便取的。

original: The voice of the Ancestor Moth has always been an integral part of reading the Elder Scrolls.
string: 先祖飛蛾的聲音一直以來都是閱讀上古卷軸的重要關鍵。

original: If this ends up being a wasted trip, your friend Dexion and I are going to have some words when we get back.
string: 如果這趟旅程白費力氣的話，我得要跟你的朋友，戴希翁好好談一談。

original: Hmph... not very impressive, is it?
string: 嗯......沒什麼嘛。

original: That's a fine looking animal you've got there. I had a dog once. Kept getting fur in my mead.
string: 你那頭動物看起來真漂亮。我以前有條狗。它的毛老是跑進蜜酒裡。

original: What kind of beast is that? No law against it, but if that thing starts attacking people, it's getting a sword in the gullet.
string: 那是什麼動物？沒有法律禁止你，但要是那東西開始攻擊人，就等著在咽喉插把劍吧。

original: Sorry, maybe next time.
string: 抱歉，下次吧。

original: (Growl)
string: （咆哮）

original: (Growl)
string: （咆哮）

original: Silence, cur. No meat for you today.
string: 安靜，野狗。今天沒有肉吃。

original: (Growl)
string: （咆哮）

original: I've already got an animal with me, maybe next time.
string: 我已經有一隻動物了。下次吧。

original: Come on boy, let's go.
string: 來吧，小子。走啦。

original: (Bark)
string: （犬吠）

original: Come on boy, let's go.
string: 來吧，小子。走啦。

original: (Bark)
string: （犬吠）

original: Let's sate our hunger together.
string: 我們一起滿足食慾吧。

original: (Whine)
string: （哀嚎）

original: Let's go. (Dismiss current animal)
string: 走吧。（解散目前的動物）

original: What's wrong? You want to go hunt some vampires?
string: 怎麼了嗎？你想要獵殺吸血鬼嗎？

original: (Bark)
string: （犬吠）

original: (Bark)
string: （犬吠）

original: Ready for some bloodshed, beast?
string: 想要去吃人嗎，野獸？

original: (Whine)
string: （哀嚎）

original: (Whine)
string: （哀嚎）

original: Does that mean you can take us to it now?
string: 妳可以帶我們去拿卷軸嗎？

original: Yes. Please, follow me.
string: 是的。請跟我來。

original: One more word of warning. There's a dragon that calls itself Durnehviir roaming the Cairn.
string: 還有一點要注意。有一頭自稱度尼維爾的龍翱翔於石塚之中。一定要小心牠。

original: The Ideal Masters have charged him with overseeing the Keepers, and will undoubtedly investigate the fact that the barrier has fallen.
string: 理想之主吩咐牠監督守護者。防護罩降下來後牠一定會來查探。

original: Drinking it gives you strength, but it also gets you pretty messed up... That's why we thought of putting it in the skooma.
string: 喝下去之後你會增加力氣，但是也會讓人頭昏腦脹......所以我們才會把這個摻在斯庫瑪內。

original: Then there's no hope for them.
string: 那他們就沒救了。

original: Perhaps they'll never return to their former appearance, but over the centuries, I've noticed a rise in their intellect.
string: 或許他們永遠無法回復原本的樣貌，但是經過數百年，我發現他們的智商有所成長。

original: If a line of communication could be established with them, maybe they can find peace.
string: 如果能夠與他們建立溝通管道的話，也許他們會找到安寧。

original: It's the only way they'll discover that they weren't always malignant... they were once a proud and prosperous race.
string: 只有透過這個方式才能讓他們理解他們不是一直都是惡毒的......他們也曾經是個驕傲且富裕的種族。

original: Why?
string: 為什麼？

original: The twisted forms you've seen didn't occur overnight. It isn't a plague or a disease that ravaged our species.
string: 你看到的扭曲型態不是瞬間產生的。我們並未遭受疾病或是瘟疫的襲擊。

original: The dwarves may have stolen their sight, but it took many generations for them to become what they are today.
string: 矮人或許偷走了他們的視力，但是他們也花了幾個世代才演變成現在這個樣子。

original: Can the Betrayed ever be cured?
string: 背離之徒有辦法被治癒嗎？

original: I feel nothing but sympathy for the Betrayed, despite my actions against them.
string: 我對背離之徒的感覺只有滿滿的同情，儘管我的行為和他們是對立的。

original: But I'm afraid that they're well beyond a cure at this point.
string: 恐怕他們現在已經無法被治癒了。

original: The Silver Hand
string: 白銀之手

original: Aela and Skjor want to speak to me about some kind of special mission for the Companions.
string: 艾拉和斯科約爾想找我談一個戰友團的特別任務。

original: Skjor and Aela say they have some sort of special assignment for me. I'm supposed to meet them underneath the Skyforge tonight.
string: 艾拉和斯科約爾想找我談一個戰友團的特別任務。他們今晚會在天空熔爐底下和我碰面。

original: I have ascended to the Circle which leads the Companions, and now share their blood as a werewolf. To celebrate my new status, Skjor and Aela have invited me to attack a Silver Hand camp nearby.
string: 我已經升入領導著戰友團的圓環，並且分享了他們的血成為了一隻狼人。為了慶祝我的新生，斯科約爾和艾拉邀請我一同去襲擊附近一處白銀之手營地。

original: I have ascended to the Circle which leads the Companions, and now share their blood as a werewolf. Aela led me to a Silver Hand stronghold where Skjor fell in battle. She has enlisted me on her quest for revenge.
string: 我已經升入領導著戰友團的圓環，並且分享了他們的血成為了一隻狼人。艾拉領著我到了一處斯科約爾倒下的白銀之手要塞，我已經是她復仇名單上的貴賓了。

original: Talk to Skjor
string: 和斯科約爾交談

original: Meet with Skjor at night
string: 在晚上和斯科約爾碰面

original: Enter the Underforge
string: 進入地下熔爐

original: Participate in the blood ritual
string: 參與鮮血儀式

original: Talk to Aela
string: 和艾拉交談

original: Kill the werewolf hunters
string: 殺死狼人獵手

original: Talk to Aela
string: 和艾拉交談

original: Speaking With Silence
string: 盡在不言中

original: I'm on my way to meet Mercer Frey at the ruins of Snow Veil Sanctum, Karliah's last known location. Together, Mercer and I intend to hunt her down and make her pay for Gallus's murder.
string: 我準備前往雪幔聖所的廢墟去見墨瑟．弗雷，那裡是我們所知卡莉亞最後一次出現的地方。我和墨瑟打算一起找到她，讓她為加盧斯的死付出代價。

original: The tables have unexpectedly turned, and Mercer Frey has been revealed as Gallus's killer. I now find myself in Karliah's care after Mercer tried to murder me, claiming I'd outlasted my usefulness by witnessing their conversation. I've also discovered that Mercer, Gallus and Karliah were members of some sort of group calling themselves "The Nightingales" - guardians in service to the goddess Nocturnal. What they're protecting or what this has to do with the Guild is still a mystery to me.
string: 情況有了巨大的轉變，墨瑟．弗雷似乎才是殺死加盧斯的兇手。在發現墨瑟準備殺死我之後，我發現我根本是被卡莉亞算計了，因為只有我聽到了他們之間的對話我才能為卡莉亞作證。我發現墨瑟、加盧斯和卡莉亞都是一個叫做「夜鶯」的組織的前成員，他們為諾克圖娜爾女神服務。他們保護的目標以及與公會的關係對我來說還是個謎。

original: Meet Mercer Frey outside Snow Veil Sanctum
string: 在雪幔聖所外與墨瑟．弗雷見面

original: Enter Snow Veil Sanctum
string: 進入雪幔聖所

original: Find Karliah
string: 找到卡莉亞

original: Speak to Karliah
string: 與卡莉亞交談

original: Waking Nightmare
string: 惡夢甦醒

original: I've overheard two citizens of Dawnstar complaining about horrible nightmares. They seem to be relying on a priest of Mara named Erandur for assistance.
string: 我偶然聽到晨星的兩位市民在抱怨恐怖的夢魘。他們似乎在尋求一名叫做依蘭杜爾的瑪拉祭司的幫助。

original: Erandur has assured me he can end the nightmares, the source of which seems to be within Nightcaller Temple, a place of worship for Vaermina. I have agreed to assist him in this endeavor and we are now on our way.
string: 依蘭杜爾向我保證可以結束夢魘，它的源頭似乎是喚夜神殿，一個用來崇拜瓦爾迷納的地方。我答應幫助他並且一同上路了。

original: Erandur has revealed that Nightcaller Temple contains the legendary Skull of Corruption, an artifact of great power. In order to end the nightmares, we must breach the inner sanctum and allow Erandur to perform a ritual on the Skull which will render it inert.
string: 依蘭杜爾發現喚夜神殿裡存放著傳說中的墮落頭骨，一件擁有強大力量的神器。要想終結夢魘，我們需要進入內部聖所，好讓依蘭杜爾在墮落頭骨上進行一個儀式使之無效化。

original: From a tome obtained in the temple's library, Erandur has discovered a way to breach the inner sanctum. By obtaining a special liquid, we'll be able to perform a Dreamstride... travel a distance using another subject's dreams.
string: 從神殿圖書館的一本書上，依蘭杜爾找到了進入內部聖所的方法。靠著一種特殊的液體我們可以進行夢中漫步——在其他人的夢中行走。

original: With Vaermina's Torpor in hand, I am ready to undergo the Dreamstride. I must drink the liquid which will enable me to enter the dreams of those who still slumber within these walls and use them to breach the inner sanctum.
string: 靠著手中的瓦爾迷納的睡眠藥水，我已準備好進行夢中漫步。我必須喝下這種藥水，好讓我進入這神殿內仍在睡眠的人夢中，然後靠著他們進入內部聖所。

original: I've found myself within the dreams of a priest of Vaermina. I am experiencing the Orc invasion of the temple over a decade ago. In the guise of the priest, I've been tasked with releasing the Miasma and placing everyone inside the temple in a deep sleep.
string: 我發現我自己進入了一個瓦爾迷納祭司的夢中。我體驗到了十數年前獸人進攻這座神殿的時刻。我在夢境中看見的這位祭司，被命令釋放毒氣以便讓神殿內所有人進入深深的睡眠。

original: After awakening from the Dreamstride, I was able to remove the barrier to the inner sanctum. I must now follow Erandur to the Skull of Corruption so it can be rendered inert.
string: 從「夢中漫步」中醒來，我已經可以移走內部聖所的屏障了。我必須跟著依蘭杜爾去把墮落頭骨無效化。

original: I've heard the words of the goddess Vaermina, who claims that Erandur will kill me after the ritual to destroy the Skull of Corruption is complete. I must make a choice; either allow Erandur to complete the ritual and destroy the Skull, or kill Erandur and wield the Skull of Corruption as my own.
string: 我聽到了瓦爾迷納女神的話語，她宣稱依蘭杜爾在舉行儀式毀掉墮落頭骨後會殺死我。我必須做一個選擇：允許依蘭杜爾舉行儀式毀掉頭骨，或者殺死他後將墮落頭骨據為己有。

original: I've made my decision, and allowed Erandur to live. The Skull of Corruption has been destroyed and Erandur has offered his services as a companion if I should ever need his assistance.
string: 我做出決定，讓依蘭杜爾活著。墮落頭骨已經被摧毀，如果我需要他的幫助，依蘭杜爾將與我同行。
